data.title: Shorten apm paths in bundle
data.body:
Previously app was installed at `apm/node_modules/atom-package-manager` in the distribution.

This made the paths longer than they needed to be, so the `node_modules/atom-package-manager` folder now sits directly in the root `apm` folder.

All paths in the install are now under 200 characters so hopefully all long path install errors will no longer occur. You can run `script/grunt output-long-paths` to check this.

Closes #5109

data.title: Improve tab switching performance
Update default themes
data.body: Use `one` themes as the default

data.title: Atom does not run on RHEL 6.6
data.body:
The Atom installation page says it supports RHEL. I have installed Atom on RHEL 6.6, and Atom doesn't work. The failed dependencies are with GLIBC_2.14, GLIBC_2.15, and libstdc++. 

/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.14' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/atom)
/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version`GLIBC_2.14' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/libchromiumcontent.so)
/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.14' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/libgcrypt.so.11)
/usr/local/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version`GLIBC_2.15' not found (required by /usr/local/share/atom/libgcrypt.so.11)

So does this mean that RHEL 6.6 isn't supported? I have installed gcc 4.6.2 to get around the problem with libstdc++, but now am stuck with the glibc issues. My glibc version is 2.12.

data.title: Warn users if they are installing/using pre-1.0 packages
Panes are not restored correctly after a reload
data.body:
Often when I reload, my panes are not restored with the right items. Maybe an exception is being thrown during teardown, preventing serialization from completing?
- [x] TextBuffer's history sometimes throws an exception during serialization, probably because `Checkpoints` don't implement `serialize`. atom/text-buffer@bfbee5f503dccc1aedc92ef1142f8cbccdc1021d

Any thoughts?

data.title: Package latest packages in Atom
data.body:
**A LOT** of this Repository's commits are of package version upgrade.
I wonder why aren't you guys `latest` instead of a specific version (npm supports `latest` as version, does apm too?). That would make the commit history a lot more readable.

data.title: Keymap error for commands on spanish command layout
data.body:
Hi! I am using Atom on a Linux (Ubuntu) machine and I  have spanish (es-ES) layout on my keyboard.
When writting code everything is ok, but with commands, the Key Binding Resolver console is showing bas results.

I suspect it is showing what the key combination would be for an (EN) keyboard layout. For example if I press (SHIFT) - ,   it show < symbol. But this is not correct in a spanish keyboard, we have ; there. So looks that it is taking waht is is suposed to be in that key, not what the system is actually passing.

data.title: Ability to specify display and space (OS X) within which to open a new window
data.body:
I think it would be really useful to be able to tell atom to open a new window on a specific space which resides on a specific physical display. Use case would be in combination with a few other tools to create a new space on a specific display, open a terminal window with specific geometry, an atom window with specific geometry, both relative to the display's current resolution. (amongst other things)

there are workarounds I'm thinking about if this isn't possible, but if it's simple to add, it would simplify the scripting pipeline a bit.

data.title: Update atom-text-editor selector example
data.body: Now that `.editor` and `.editor-colors` are replaced with `atom-text-editor`.

data.title: Make popover-list max-height relative to viewport
data.body:
It's not really a bug, but I think the `max-height: 200px` is a bit arbitrary.  On small screens it may be too much, on large screens perhaps you could show some more. I think it would make sense to use the `vh` unit here.

PS. Ran into this when debugging a little layout issue in autocomplete-plus. https://github.com/atom-community/autocomplete-plus/issues/194

data.title: Add notification when user's stylesheet has styles broken by shadow DOM
data.body: See https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4962

data.title: Request for package information failed: getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND
data.body:
Hello, 
this could possibly be related to #2372. Here is the exact error message: 
`Request for package information failed: getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND`. The output from `script/build` is included below.

``` sh
[harry@harry-laptop atom]$ script/build
Node: v0.10.35
npm: v2.1.18
Installing build modules...
npm WARN engine npm@1.4.28: wanted: {"node":">=0.8","npm":"1"} (current: {"node":"0.10.35","npm":"2.1.18"})
Installing apm...
npm ERR! fetch failed https://registry.npmjs.org/read/-/read-1.0.5.tgz
npm ERR! fetch failed https://registry.npmjs.org/read/-/read-1.0.5.tgz
../src/keytar_posix.cc: In function ‘bool keytar::AddPassword(const string&, const string&, const string&)’:
../src/keytar_posix.cc:23:31: warning: ‘GnomeKeyringResult gnome_keyring_store_password_sync(const GnomeKeyringPasswordSchema*, const gchar*, const gchar*, const gchar*, ...)’ is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/gnome-keyring-1/gnome-keyring.h:483): Use 'secret_password_store_sync' instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
   GnomeKeyringResult result = gnome_keyring_store_password_sync(
                               ^
../src/keytar_posix.cc:30:11: warning: ‘GnomeKeyringResult gnome_keyring_store_password_sync(const GnomeKeyringPasswordSchema*, const gchar*, const gchar*, const gchar*, ...)’ is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/gnome-keyring-1/gnome-keyring.h:483): Use 'secret_password_store_sync' instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
       NULL);
           ^
../src/keytar_posix.cc: In function ‘bool keytar::GetPassword(const string&, const string&, std::string*)’:
../src/keytar_posix.cc:38:31: warning: ‘GnomeKeyringResult gnome_keyring_find_password_sync(const GnomeKeyringPasswordSchema*, gchar**, ...)’ is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/gnome-keyring-1/gnome-keyring.h:497): Use 'secret_password_lookup_sync' instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
   GnomeKeyringResult result = gnome_keyring_find_password_sync(
                               ^
../src/keytar_posix.cc:43:11: warning: ‘GnomeKeyringResult gnome_keyring_find_password_sync(const GnomeKeyringPasswordSchema*, gchar**, ...)’ is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/gnome-keyring-1/gnome-keyring.h:497): Use 'secret_password_lookup_sync' instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
       NULL);
           ^
../src/keytar_posix.cc:49:3: warning: ‘void gnome_keyring_free_password(gchar*)’ is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/gnome-keyring-1/gnome-keyring.h:513): Use 'secret_password_free' instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
   gnome_keyring_free_password(raw_passwords);
   ^
../src/keytar_posix.cc:49:44: warning: ‘void gnome_keyring_free_password(gchar*)’ is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/gnome-keyring-1/gnome-keyring.h:513): Use 'secret_password_free' instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
   gnome_keyring_free_password(raw_passwords);
                                            ^
../src/keytar_posix.cc: In function ‘bool keytar::DeletePassword(const string&, const string&)’:
../src/keytar_posix.cc:54:10: warning: ‘GnomeKeyringResult gnome_keyring_delete_password_sync(const GnomeKeyringPasswordSchema*, ...)’ is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/gnome-keyring-1/gnome-keyring.h:509): Use 'secret_password_clear_sync' instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
   return gnome_keyring_delete_password_sync(
          ^
../src/keytar_posix.cc:58:11: warning: ‘GnomeKeyringResult gnome_keyring_delete_password_sync(const GnomeKeyringPasswordSchema*, ...)’ is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/gnome-keyring-1/gnome-keyring.h:509): Use 'secret_password_clear_sync' instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
       NULL) == GNOME_KEYRING_RESULT_OK;
           ^
../src/keytar_posix.cc: In function ‘bool keytar::FindPassword(const string&, std::string*)’:
../src/keytar_posix.cc:63:31: warning: ‘GnomeKeyringResult gnome_keyring_find_password_sync(const GnomeKeyringPasswordSchema*, gchar**, ...)’ is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/gnome-keyring-1/gnome-keyring.h:497): Use 'secret_password_lookup_sync' instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
   GnomeKeyringResult result = gnome_keyring_find_password_sync(
                               ^
../src/keytar_posix.cc:67:11: warning: ‘GnomeKeyringResult gnome_keyring_find_password_sync(const GnomeKeyringPasswordSchema*, gchar**, ...)’ is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/gnome-keyring-1/gnome-keyring.h:497): Use 'secret_password_lookup_sync' instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
       NULL);
           ^
../src/keytar_posix.cc:73:3: warning: ‘void gnome_keyring_free_password(gchar*)’ is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/gnome-keyring-1/gnome-keyring.h:513): Use 'secret_password_free' instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
   gnome_keyring_free_password(raw_passwords);
   ^
../src/keytar_posix.cc:73:44: warning: ‘void gnome_keyring_free_password(gchar*)’ is deprecated (declared at /usr/include/gnome-keyring-1/gnome-keyring.h:513): Use 'secret_password_free' instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
   gnome_keyring_free_password(raw_passwords);
                                            ^
Installing modules ✓
Installing atom-dark-syntax@0.26.0 ✗
Request for package information failed: getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND
```

Attempting to keep going (keep calling `script/build`) results in this:

``` sh
[harry@harry-laptop atom]$ script/build
Node: v0.10.35
npm: v1.4.28
Installing build modules...
Installing apm...
Installing modules ✓
Installing atom-dark-syntax@0.26.0 ✓
Installing atom-dark-ui@0.46.0 ✓
Installing atom-light-syntax@0.26.0 ✓
Installing atom-light-ui@0.40.0 ✓
Installing base16-tomorrow-dark-theme@0.25.0 ✓
Installing base16-tomorrow-light-theme@0.8.0 ✓
Installing solarized-dark-syntax@0.32.0 ✓
Installing solarized-light-syntax@0.19.0 ✓
Installing archive-view@0.44.0 ✓
Installing autocomplete@0.43.0 ✓
Installing autoflow@0.21.0 ✓
Installing autosave@0.20.0 ✗
Unable to download https://www.atom.io/api/packages/autosave/versions/0.20.0/tarball: getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND
```

To check if it was possibly an issue with the website that needed to be reached, I manually went to the link in my web browser. This results in a popup asking me if I'd like to download the tarball so I don't think it's an issue with a proxy or anything (I have no proxy or special internet setups).

This is affecting: Manjaro Ascella (0.8.11) 64-bit. Any help is much appreciated as this is my day-to-day editor.
### Edit

The version affected is v0.174.0 I believe. It was cloned from the main repository just a few minutes ago.

data.title: find not working
data.body: command-f and command-shift-f have completely stopped working. on osx yosemite. i tried reinstalling everything. can anyone confirm this?

data.title: Warp function works wrong with full-width letters(Chinese)
data.body:
![default](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1845937/5805673/f8f86dec-a04b-11e4-8cc4-20661e3b1dc6.PNG)

You could see that warp works fine with half-width letters(English) at first line.  
But something wrong with warp in second line which filled with Chinese characters.
Actually, the correct character after the warp should be "一" , however, it showed "九".
Currently using the latest version(0.174.0 2015/1/16)
